com.RecSys.Recommender

Class MyRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.RecSys.Recommender.MyRecommender

  • public class MyRecommender
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains contains our recommendation logic.
    Author:
    Robert and Daniel

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyRecommender

        public MyRecommender(java.lang.String ratedFileName)
        This constructor has to be called. It permanently stores the ratedFileName for the recommender.
        Parameters:
        ratedFileName - The path of the file that contains the ratings (Structure: SessionID, ProductID, Rating (e.g. 5.0))

    • Method Detail

      • createRecommendationsFile

        public java.lang.String createRecommendationsFile(int numberOfRecommendations,
                                                  java.lang.Boolean svdRecommender)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method creates a file that contains a certain amount of recommended products for some users based on the input file and the parameters that are defined in the inner class MyRecommenderBuilder.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRecommendations - How many recommendations per user
        svdRecommender - True if SVDRecommender should be used
        Returns:
        Path of recommendations file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • printRecommendationsToConsole

        public void printRecommendationsToConsole(java.lang.Boolean svdRecommender,
                                          int numberOfRecommendations)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This Method prints the recommendations onto the console based on the input file and the parameters that are defined in the inner class MyRecommenderBuilder.
        Parameters:
        svdRecommender - True if SVD recommender should be used.
        numberOfRecommendations - How many recommendations per User
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • evaluateRecommender

        public double evaluateRecommender()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the evaluation of the recommender that is defined in the inner Class MyRecommenderBuilder and prints it on the console.
        Returns:
        a double representing the average absolute difference between the actual rating and the prediction
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • mergeRecommendationsFiles

        public static java.lang.String mergeRecommendationsFiles(java.lang.String SVDPath,
                                                         java.lang.String ChoiEtAlPath)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        merges the RecommendationsFiles of the SVDRecommender and the approach by ChoiEtAl. Resulting File is not sorted.
        Parameters:
        SVDPath - Path of the SVD recommendations file
        ChoiEtAlPath - Path of the recommendations file with the approach by ChoiEtAl
        Returns:
        mergedRecommendationsFiles Path of the result file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createFinalRecommendationsFile

        public static java.lang.String createFinalRecommendationsFile(java.lang.String mergedRecommendationsFile,
                                                              int numberOfRecommendations)
                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Print the final recommendations for every user to a file by selecting the X highest ranked products for each user. Can be used directly after mergeRecommendationsFiles(String, String) to combine both recommendation approaches.
        Parameters:
        mergedRecommendationsFile - Path of the file which contains the merged recommendations
        numberOfRecommendations - How many recommendations per user?
        Returns:
        createFinalRecommendationsFile Path of the final recommendations file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • evaluateRecommendationsFile

        public static java.lang.String evaluateRecommendationsFile(java.lang.String recommendationsFileName,
                                                           java.lang.String mergedFileName)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Sees if the recommendationsFile corresponds to the mergedFile, i.e. if the recommended buys reflect the actual buys. Correctly predicted buys are printed in a new file. Incorrect ones are shown in the console. EDIT: Amount of correctly predicted buys will always be zero, because only products are recommended that have not been clicked on before i.e. that do not appear in the merged file.
        Parameters:
        recommendationsFileName - path of the file with the recommendations
        mergedFileName - path of the file that contains the merged clicks and buys
        Returns:
        A string that represents the path to the Evaluation File
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
